prop.head.headtext: Thorburn, Law of Confidential Business Information

prop.head.label.name: Chapter
prop.head.headtext: Confidential Business Information and the Employment Relationship

para.paratext: Closely related to the employee's duty of fidelity is the common law duty of confidentiality. The duty of confidentiality is rooted in the duty of good faith and is based upon the intimacy or trust implicit in the employment relationship. This duty is implied for all employees in respect of information the employer can show is confidential at law. The most common way in which a conflict of interest develops is through an employee's misuse of the employer's business information, either during or after the employment relationship, to compete for corporate opportunities or customers. It is becoming more common for employers to include a formal clause in the employment agreement that restricts the employee's use of business information, including customer lists, trade secrets, company manuals, business data and other forms of information.
